      • resetWarmUp

      • isWarmedUp

        private boolean isWarmedUp(Layer<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> l,
                           double anomalyScore)
        Checks the anomaly score against a known threshold which indicates that the TM predictions have been "warmed up". When there have been enough occurrences within the threshold, we conclude that the algorithms have been adequately stabilized.
        Parameters:
        l - the Layer in question
        anomalyScore - the current anomaly score
        Returns:

      • testBasicClassifierSetup

        public void testBasicClassifierSetup()
        Simple test to verify data gets passed through the CLAClassifier configured within the chain of components.

      • testMoreComplexSpatialPoolerPriming

        public void testMoreComplexSpatialPoolerPriming()
        The SpatialPooler sometimes needs to have data run through it prior to passing the data on to subsequent algorithmic components. This tests the ability to specify exactly the number of input records for the SpatialPooler to consume before passing records on.

      • test2ndAndSubsequentSubscribersPossible

        public void test2ndAndSubsequentSubscribersPossible()
        Tests the ability for multiple subscribers to receive copies of a given Layer's computed values.

      • testAnomalySetup

        public void testAnomalySetup()

        Complex test that tests the Anomaly function automatically being setup and working. To test this, we do the following:

        1. Reset the warm up state vars
        2. Warm up prediction inferencing - make sure predictions are trained
        3. Throw in an anomalous record
        4. Test to make sure the Layer detects the anomaly, and that it is significantly registered

      • testGetAllPredictions

        public void testGetAllPredictions()

      • testObservableRetrieval

        public void testObservableRetrieval()
        Test that a given layer can return an Observable capable of service multiple subscribers.

      • testFullLayerFluentAssembly

        public void testFullLayerFluentAssembly()
